content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is an example of how you can do this in Julia:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits{T <: Real}
    value::T
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, "$(fwu.value) $(fwu.unit)")
end
```
In this code snippet, `FloatWithUnits` is a struct that holds a real number (`T <: Real`) and a string representing the unit of measurement (`unit::String`). The `show` function is defined to print out the value and unit in the desired format.
